member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetCharacteristics

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets various flags that describe the media item.

member.param: Receives a bitwise OR of flags from the enumeration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetDuration

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the duration of the media item.

param.name: guidPositionType
param.para: Specifies the unit of time for the duration value. The following value is defined.

listheader.description:
100-nanosecond units.
The value returned in pvDurationValue is a LARGE_INTEGER.
Variant type (vt): VT_I8
Variant member: hVal

member.param: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the duration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetMediaPlayer

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets a pointer to the MFPlay player object that created the media item.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the player object's interface. The caller must release the interface.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetMetadata

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets a property store that contains metadata for the source, such as author or title.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the IPropertyStore interface of a read-only property store. The caller must release the interface.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetNumberOfStreams

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the number of streams (audio, video, and other) in the media item.

member.param: Receives the number of streams.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetObject

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the object that was used to create the media item.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the object's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The media item was created from a URL, not from an object.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetPresentationAttribute

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queries the media item for a presentation attribute.

param.name: guidMFAttribute
param.para: GUID that identifies the attribute value to query.
For a list of presentation attributes, see Presentation Descriptor Attributes.

member.param: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the value. The method fills the PROPVARIANT with a copy of the stored value. Call PropVariantClear to free the memory allocated by the method.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetStartStopPosition

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the start and stop times for the media item.

member.param: Receives the unit of time for the start position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

Receives the start position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStartPositionType parameter. The pvStartValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStartPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.
Receives the unit of time for the stop position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

Stop position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStopPositionType parameter. The pvStopValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStopPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetStreamAttribute

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queries the media item for a stream attribute.

member.param: Zero-based index of the stream. To get the number of streams, call .

param.name: guidMFAttribute
param.para: GUID that identifies the attribute value to query. Possible values are listed in the following topics:

member.param: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the value. The method fills the PROPVARIANT with a copy of the stored value. Call PropVariantClear to free the memory allocated by this method.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetStreamSelection

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queries whether a stream is selected to play.

member.param: Zero-based index of the stream. To get the number of streams, call .

listheader.description: The stream is selected. During playback, this stream will play.
The stream is not selected. During playback, this stream will not play.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetURL

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the URL that was used to create the media item.

member.param: Receives a pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the URL. The caller must free the string by calling .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: No URL is associated with this media item.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetUserData

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Gets the application-defined value stored in the media item.

member.param: Receives the application-defined value for the media item.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.HasAudio

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queries whether the media item contains an audio stream.

member.param: Receives the value TRUE if the media item contains at least one audio stream, or FALSE otherwise.
Receives the value TRUE if at least one audio stream is selected, or FALSE otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.HasVideo

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queries whether the media item contains a video stream.

member.param: Receives the value TRUE if the media item contains at least one video stream, or FALSE otherwise.
Receives the value TRUE if at least one video stream is selected, or FALSE otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.IsProtected

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Queries whether the media item contains protected content.
summary.div: Note Currently does not support playing protected content.

param.name: pfProtected
param.para: Receives one of the following values.

listheader.description: The media item contains protected content. Attempting to play this media item will cause a playback error.
The media item does not contain protected content.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.SetStartStopPosition

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets the start and stop time for the media item.

member.param: Unit of time for the start position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

Start position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStartPositionType parameter. The pvStartValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStartPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.
Unit of time for the stop position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

Stop position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStopPositionType parameter. The pvStopValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStopPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description:
Invalid start or stop time. Any of the following can cause this error:
Time less than zero.
Time greater than the total duration of the media item.
Stop time less than start time.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.SetStreamSelection

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Selects or deselects a stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of the stream. To get the number of streams, call .

param.name: fEnabled
param.para: Specify whether to select or deselect the stream.

listheader.description: The stream is selected. During playback, this stream will play.
The stream is not selected. During playback, this stream will not play.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.SetStreamSink

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Sets a media sink for the media item. A media sink is an object that consumes the data from one or more streams.

member.param: Zero-based index of a stream on the media source. The media sink will receive the data from this stream.

param.name: pMediaSink
param.para: IUnknown pointer that specifies the media sink. Pass in one of the following:

item.description: A pointer to a stream sink. Every media sink contains one or more stream sinks. Each stream sink receives the data from one stream. The stream sink must expose the interface.

A pointer to an activation object that creates the media sink. The activation object must expose the interface. The media item uses the first stream sink on the media sink (that is, the stream sink at index 0).
NULL. If you set pMediaSink to NULL, the default media sink for the stream type is used.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.SetUserData

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Stores an application-defined value in the media item.

member.param: The application-defined value.
member.returns: This method can return one of these values.

summary.div: Note Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Represents a media item. A media item is an abstraction for a source of media data, such as a video file. Use this interface to get information about the source, or to change certain playback settings, such as the start and stop times. To get a pointer to this interface, call one of the following methods:
